reason: I had a car accident with some internal bleeding and broken ankle.

Additional Comments: Only 1 agency nurse was really horrible, rude and withheld medication that was prescribed for me which was extremely stressful, I complained to the hospital afterwards.  All other staff were professional and friendly.  There was a case of the Dr asking for a certain medication to be withheld however this continued to be administered to me which I brought to the Dr's attention when she said she was confused as to why my condition was not improving, I believe this prolonged my stay in hospital as my condition improved when the Dr's orders were followed.  There was another case where more that prescribed fluid was administered to me, the side effect was frequent toilet visits which was not disastrous but another case of the Dr's orders not being followed.  Dr advised me to eat little often, have replacement meal drinks when I could manage them to build up my strength again after not eating for 8 days however the hospital routine did not allow for this and I was served 3 large meals per day and denied meal replacement drinks when the patient opposite me was given meal replacement drinks when they didn't want to drink them.  The hospital could not cater to me meal requirements as suggested by the Dr and Nutrionist that came to advise me which contributed to me requesting to leave hospital earlier than the Dr wanted to discharge me so that I could follow the eating suggestions made by them.  My husband brought me the meal replacement drinks and food I was prescribed in the interim which should not be necessary.

I then slipped in the diarrhoea and fell and hurt my knee which was never checked. I felt so embarrassed. I felt further embarrassed when a 19 year old male nurse was sent to shower me and clean me up.
Additional Comments: My diabetic medicine was not given at the correct dose despite my daughter repeatedly telling the staff. After one week a diabetic consultant came to see me and put me back in the correct dose.

I was left on a hard metal trolley for 3 days before being moved to a ward.
